content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it easy to be done

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice idea, pretty easy to see the pattern with the test cases chosen. Not too hard to code a solution once you see the pattern.

The puzzle is great, it's clear, but the objective of the clash is written in the stub.

Please change "write Longest Length of numbers of 012345556789 is 3" to "write answer" or so.


Btw, I don't remember it well, but isn't the input/output shown, in a reverse? If so, the goal is explicitly revealed...

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good reverse clash. Neat and good to work on.

Nice job, @KevinStar.

from itertools import groupby

s = input()
groups = [list(g) for k, g in groupby(s)]
max_length = max(len(group) for group in groups if group[0].isdigit())

print(max_length)

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer").

Thanks.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: validators = testcases

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Need to have differents tests and validators before the 3 approves :(

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Tests and validators are the same.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This programm will help us to improve our level

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: There are many similar clashes, but this is pretty good for reverse mode

While you changed the names to 'Test case1', 'Test Case2', ... 'Test Case6', I hope you are aware that some of those are validators: during real play a player will only see cases 'Zero', 'Test Case1', 'Test Case3' and 'Test Case5'; the other four will be hidden validators.

Personally, I only got it after checking your solution code. I think the four test cases are not enough for people to see the connection. If you meant the other cases to also be visible for the player, you should turn those into test cases as well, and come up with similar validator cases.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

To my opinion, the first test case should be more obvious like
Input: `11010011111110010`, Output: `7`

And as an idea to make it a little more interesting. Maybe, find the length of the longest succession of either 0s or 1s ?. Ex., Input: `00101100000001101`, Output: `7`
Hi, I think it's too unclear for the Reverse mode. I don't see how you think of removing the zeros to end up with the solution. Maybe the example it's too complicated.
It's not clear to what you have to do with this is

* If you want to enable Reverse mode only, please disable the other modes.

* Your clash will be a duplicate of the existing one if you have Fastest and Shortest modes enabled:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/7996fdbe0895a04a557bc849a8c20b762e7f

* Each pair of test and validator should be similar but different. Please revise the cases so that there are no duplicates.

* Stub generator: Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer").
Tests and validators are the same. Please consider withdrawing your approval. Thanks.
Tests and validators are the same. Please consider withdrawing your approval. Thanks.

The input and output of the cases is revealed, but not the statement sections 'Input' and 'Output'.

Still, if a clash is meant as only reverse, I think the creator should keep all statement fields empty, so that reviewers can really check it as a reverse clash without being spoiled.

Only problem I would recommend fixing is making the answers for the Validators different from the tests. Currently 4 tests give 1 as the Output and 4 Validators also have 1 as Output, meaning that a lazy clasher could just say "print(1)" and get 66%.

Making some of those Validators instead have 2 or 3 or 5 as Output means it's harder to guess a hacky answer that will get a high score.

The other answers all line up too well too, with both Test/Validator 3 Outputting 7 and both Test/Validator 6 Ouputting 88.

That's a nice suggestion! Your idea will improve the test cases and might help coders understand the step-by-step coding process better than the current cases. 

However, I think creating a test case that appears easy but also confusing could make the coding process more enjoyable.

If someone who would like to get passed some case 
I think It would be quite amusing if he knew whether to just only print(1)

^ Agreed.
It would also be nice if you could check Reverse clashes with JUST the test cases (no Validators) in the IDE, to be sure that the clash will actually be solvable once accepted.
Nicest would be if 'Test in IDE' would give you the options 'Test as fastest/shortest', 'Test as reverse', and a checkbox option 'Hide validators'.
If only CodinGame.com had an active web development team that was interested in improving users' experiences on this site. :/
